question: What is the role of the Students’ Register?
answer: The Students’ Register serves for the registration of students and for budgetary and statistical purposes.
answer_generated: The role of the Students’ Register is for the registration of students and for budgetary and statistical purposes. It contains information about individual students required by the Act and the Ministry. It is part of the CTU electronic information system and is maintained by the study departments and S&R Departments in an operative manner. Only authorized employees of CTU can enter information into the Students’ Register and the study documentation.
context:
Document 1: (5) The statement  from  the CTU electronic  information  system  confirmed  by the faculty  serves  as the 
statement  of studies.  
 
 Artic le 33 
Students’  Register  
(1) Pursuant  to Section  88 of the Act, CTU keeps  a Students’  Register.   The Students’  Register  serves  
for registration  of students  and for budgetary  and statistical  purposes.  
 (2) The Students’  Register  contains  information  about  individual  students  required  by the Act and the 
Ministry.   Study and Examination  Rules for Students  at CTU 
______________ _____________________________________________________________  
 
29 (3) The Students’  Register  is part of the CTU electronic  information  system.   It is kept  by the study  
departments  and S&R Departments  in an operative  manner.   Only  authorized  employees  of CTU 
can enter  information  into the Students’  Register  and to the study  documentation.
